content: quote: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - President Barack Obama will appear on Thursday as a guest on "The Tonight Show with Jay Leno," NBC television said. Obama will make an appearance on the late-night talk show hosted by comedian Jay Leno while on a visit to Southern California, a spokeswoman for the NBC show said on Monday. "It is confirmed. He (President Obama) will be on the show on Thursday," she said. (....) +http://www.reuters.com/article/entertainmentNews/idUSTRE52F5MR20090316

content: quote: ..but the hugh bailouts started with Bush...so the ball kept rolling. So, it was a bad idea under President Bush but now that President Obama is on board it's a great idea. Record deficits will suddenly become a good thing. What worries me most is the huge spending Obama is planing. When asked what programs will be cut opr delayed to make up for the bailouts he answered with a littany of things he will neither cut or delay: infrastructure, health care reform...At some point, inflation has to be a very real concern. If enough money is printed it becomes worthless. See Germany of 1920 and Hungary of 1946 for reference.

content: quote: LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - President Barack Obama will appear on Thursday as a guest on "The Tonight Show with Jay Leno," NBC television said. Obama will make an appearance on the late-night talk show hosted by comedian Jay Leno while on a visit to Southern California, a spokeswoman for the NBC show said on Monday. "It is confirmed. content: quote: ..but the hugh bailouts started with Bush...so the ball kept rolling. So, it was a bad idea under President Bush but now that President Obama is on board it's a great idea. Record deficits will suddenly become a good thing. What worries me most is the huge spending Obama is planing. When asked what programs will be cut opr delayed to make up for the bailouts he answered with a littany of things he will neither cut or delay: infrastructure, health care reform...At some point, inflation has to be a very real concern. If enough money is printed it becomes worthless. See Germany of 1920 and Hungary of 1946 for reference.
